summary: This email chain from April 2020 discusses FBI surveillance efforts to locate Ghislaine Maxwell, who is believed to be hiding in Manchester by the Sea, Massachusetts with her boyfriend. It also reveals that an attorney has proposed pleading guilty to misprision of a felony for concealing sex trafficking crimes, with a likely probation outcome, and that Maxwell's arrest is planned for late spring/early summer.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The FBI is actively trying to determine her whereabouts, believing she is in Manchester by the Sea, Massachusetts with her boyfriend. A prosecution memo for her arrest is pending approval at SDNY, with plans to charge her in late spring/early summer.

persons.name: Sweeney
persons.role: Unspecified official (possibly USA or other executive)
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who might push for Maxwell's immediate arrest, prompting a suggestion for an internal discussion first.

persons.name: ADIC
persons.context: The SAC will discuss updates with the ADIC. It is noted that the USA and the ADIC will be discussing the case, and it's possible they, together, would like to move forward with arrests.

persons.name: SAC
persons.context: Information is to be passed to the SAC for her to discuss with the ADIC.

persons.name: USA
persons.context: It is noted that the USA and the ADIC will be discussing the case.

persons.name: SSRA
persons.context: The SSRA was hesitant to approach the local police department for fear of Maxwell finding out and fleeing.

connections.description: Maxwell is believed to be 'holding up with her boyfriend' at a residence in Manchester by the Sea, Massachusetts.

connections.person2: Acting Assistant Special Agent in Charge
connections.description: They are corresponding about investigative updates, plea negotiations, and arrest timing for Maxwell.
SDNY has prosecution memos drafted for Maxwell pending final approval by the executive staff.
The attorney has proposed a guilty plea to misprision of a felony, and the prosecution team is on board with the idea.

events.title: FBI Surveillance Update on Maxwell
events.description: FBI agents discuss efforts to locate Ghislaine Maxwell, including phone analysis and surveillance considerations, concluding she is likely in Manchester by the Sea, Massachusetts.
personsInvolved: Acting Assistant Special Agent in Charge

events.title: Plea Proposal for Unnamed Individual
events.description: An attorney proposes a guilty plea for an unnamed individual to misprision of a felony (concealing sex trafficking), with a likely outcome of probation. The plea is not expected for two months to allow victim input.

events.title: Pending SDNY Approval for Maxwell Prosecution
events.description: Prosecution memos for Ghislaine Maxwell are drafted and pending final approval by SDNY Executive Staff, with plans to charge her in late spring/early summer.

keyFacts: The FBI believed Ghislaine Maxwell was hiding with her boyfriend at a remote residence in the exclusive town of Manchester by the Sea, Massachusetts, in April 2020.
An attorney for an unnamed individual proposed a guilty plea to misprision of a felony for concealing Epstein's sex trafficking crimes, with an expected sentence of probation.
The SDNY planned to charge Maxwell in late spring or early summer of 2020, but hesitated to arrest her immediately due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
The FBI considered but decided against sending a surveillance team to Massachusetts during the pandemic, planning instead to use a GPS warrant on her phone closer to the arrest date.
Prosecutors intended to allow victims to weigh in on the proposed plea deal for the unnamed individual, delaying the plea for approximately two months.
